item.text: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site. From this page you can find who we are and what we do. New sites provide this information and then claim the site as their own. You will need your own site to participate.
Pages about us.

item.prompt:
Link to a page about yourself here. Type your name enclosed in double square brackets. Then press Command/ALT-S to save.

Make all pages here yours alone with the login below.

item.text: Pages where we do and share.

item.prompt: Create pages about things you do on this wiki. Type a descriptive name of something you will be writing about. Enclose it in square brackets. Then press Command/ALT-S to save.

item.text: You can edit your copy of these pages. Press [+] to add more writing spaces. Read [[How to Wiki]] for more ideas. Follow [[Recent Changes]] here and nearby.

item.prompt: Create pages about things you do on this wiki. Type a descriptive name of something you will be writing about. Enclose it in square brackets. Then press Command/ALT-S to save.
item.text: A "thing" was the governing assembly of a Germanic society, made up of the free people of the community presided over by [[Lawspeaker]]s. Its meeting-place was called a [[Thingstead]].
item.title: Thing (assembly)

item.prompt:

item.title: Landsgemeinde
Landsgemeinde

item.prompt:
Link to a page about yourself here. Type your name enclosed in double square brackets. Then press Command/ALT-S to save.

Make all pages here yours alone with the login below.
item.text: The Landsgemeinde or "cantonal assembly" is one of the oldest forms of [[Direct Democracy]].  Formerly practised in eight [[Cantons of Switzerland]], for practical reasons, the Landsgemeinde has been abolished in all but two [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Landsgemeinde Wikipedia].
item.title: Landsgemeinde

item.text: My name is David Bovill, and I'm a long term advocator and experimenter with [[Liquid Democracy]]. My nickname (and handle on twitter) is [https://twitter.com/fortyfoxes @fortyfoxes].
item.title: David Bovill

item.text: My name is David Bovill, and I'm a long term advocator and experimenter with [[Liquid Democracy]], and I sometimes blog over at [[dsfa parlaimentofthings.org].
item.title: David Bovill

item.text: Liquid democracy, also known as [[Delegative Democracy]], is a form of democratic control whereby voting power is vested in [[Delegate]]s, rather than [[Representative]]s [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delegative_democracy Wikipedia].
item.title: Liquid Democracy

item.text: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site. This is my site for integrating notes I feel relevant to [[Deep Democracy]]. It's an eclectic mix of notes and discussions on [[Deep Ecology]], [[Liquid Democracy]], [[Legislative Theatre]], and the [[Parliament of Things]].

[[Bruno Latour]] is the philosopher behind the title of this wiki. On this wiki we [[Idea Mine]] a range of disciplines around the notion that science, law, media and politics can be remixed in new and potentially fruitful ways.
item.title: Parliament of Things

item.text: [[Currently Working On]]
Read [[How to Wiki]] for more ideas. Follow [[Recent Changes]] here and nearby.
I am a lecturer at the Harvard School of Engineering and Applied Sciences and I conduct research on learning environments for engineering design.
item.title: Teaching Machines Sites

item.title: My Neighbourhood

item.text: [[SciTopia]] is a science project (originally proposed to the Welcome Trust in 2012), that looks to create a new form of [[Scientific Institution]], based on a  analysis of the activities and practice of real world science.
item.title: SciTopia

<H3>Sites
<H3>Sites

story.text: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site. This is my site for integrating notes I feel relevant to [[Deep Democracy]]. It's an eclectic mix of notes and discussions on [[Deep Ecology]], [[Liquid Democracy]], [[Legislative Theatre]], and the [[Parliament of Things]].
Follow [[Recent Changes]] here and nearby to see what we are [[Currently Working On]].
My name is David Bovill, and I'm a long term advocator and experimenter with [[Liquid Democracy]], and I sometimes blog over at [http://parliamentofthings.org parliamentofthings.org].
story.title: David Bovill

story.text: [[Bruno Latour]] is the philosopher behind the title of this wiki. On this wiki we [[Idea Mine]] a range of disciplines around the notion that science, law, media and politics can be remixed in new and potentially fruitful ways.
story.title: Parliament of Things

story.text: A "thing" was the governing assembly of a Germanic society, made up of the free people of the community presided over by [[Lawspeaker]]s. Its meeting-place was called a [[Thingstead]].

story.text: Liquid democracy, also known as [[Delegative Democracy]], is a form of democratic control whereby voting power is vested in [[Delegate]]s, rather than [[Representative]]s [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delegative_democracy Wikipedia].
story.title: Liquid Democracy

story.text: [[SciTopia]] is a science project (originally proposed to the Welcome Trust in 2012), that looks to create a new form of [[Scientific Institution]], based on a  analysis of the activities and practice of real world science.
